intro: Myosurus egglestonii, commonly known as the Eggleston's mouse-ear, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern California. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and hairy, rounded leaves that resemble those of other mouse-ear species. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open, sunny areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
